nodes.text: The RO-D-series droid was designed and manufactured by Balmorran Arms to serve as both a labor droid and security droid for touring musicians throughout the galaxy.

A jack-of-all-trades droid, the RO-D droid could function as a labor droid to help move equipment and set up a stage for a performance and could also act as a mechanic to repair the same equipment. It also served as a bodyguard for the performers. It was highly customizable and came with over 70 chassis color schemes to match any background. It cost 14800 credits new.
A RO-D was developed for the Melody Fellowship in response to RetSpan Audionics' TribBot mimic droid, that mimicked the voice patterns of popular Fellowship stars.
